data.title: Trump Signs Executive Order To Ban TikTok In 45 Days If Parent Company Fails To Make A Sale
data.text: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Thursday evening that would effectively ban TikTok operations in the United States, if parent company ByteDance fails to make a sale within 45 days from now, CNN reported.

data.title: Microsoft slams Apple in new statement about xCloud and App Store policies
data.text: Microsoft issued a statement Thursday evening calling out Apple for its App Store policies amid a controversy over the Redmond, Wash.

data.title: Donald Trump Signs Executive Order Banning Transactions With TikTok Parent Starting In 45 Days
data.text: Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday meant to block all business with Bytedance, the parent company of TikTok, starting 45 days from now. The move comes after Trump indicated that he would ban TikTok in the United States, unless Microsoft or some other company could buy the social media platform’s U.S. operations by

data.title: Trump issues executive order banning TikTok from operating in 45 days if it's not sold by Chinese parent company
data.text: President Donald Trump on Thursday issued an executive order that would ban the social media app TikTok from operating in the US in 45 days if it is not sold by its Chinese parent company ByteDance.

data.title: Microsoft Looking To Buy TikTok's Entire Global Business, Not Just In Four Countries: FT
data.text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) is looking to buy all of TikTok’s global operations, and not just in four countries as previously indicated, according to a Financial Times report Thursday.

data.title: Trump issues executive order banning transactions with TikTok parent ByteDance after Sept. 20
data.text: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Thursday blocking all transactions with ByteDance, the company that owns TikTok, starting Sept. 20.

data.title: Jim Cramer: The Cramer Covid-19 stocks can still lead us higher
data.text: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer highlights market moves in a handful of tech stocks.

data.title: How Parse Quarterlies On Amazon, Facebook And Microsoft
data.text: You’d think corporations like Amazon with a market capitalization far north of a trillion bucks would publish quarterly reports of more than bare-bones numbers with zero interpretive commentary.

data.title: Stock Market Today: 'FAAMNGs' Do the Market's Talking
data.text: The major indices closed higher for a fifth consecutive day on Thursday.

data.title: Microsoft reportedly wants to buy TikTok's global operations
data.text: Instead of just the US, Canadian, Australian and NZ business, Microsoft is mulling a total buyout, a report says.

data.title: Dow Jones Flat as Microsoft Eyes All of TikTok, Demand Possibly Slows for Home Depot
data.text: Microsoft is reportedly considering buying all of TikTok, and an analyst suggests sales at Home Depot weakened in July.

data.title: In latest TikTok twist, Microsoft reportedly looking at buying entire social media upstart
data.text: Microsoft is considering buying a bigger chunk of fast-growing social media giant TikTok.

data.title: The US giant has a long history in China. That could cut both ways for TikTok
data.text: Microsoft has spent decades building goodwill with Beijing, and that could help its bid to buy TikTok's operations in the United States and a few other countries. That is, unless deteriorating US-China relations get in the way.

data.title: How Google Could Acquire TikTok For $60 Billion, Win Versus Microsoft
data.text: We think Google’s parent Alphabet should buy the global operations of TikTok and take another stab at a social media play after its failed attempts with Orkut and Google Plus. The prize appears meaningful this time considering that TikTok is up for grabs.
